title: The Reckoning Algorithm
outcome: Citizen juries bring the BCI itself to trial, publicly reviewing evidence of systemic abuse and Halden's secret designs. The BCI is voted 'guilty' and is permanently disabled, triggering a period of catharsis, confusion, and decentralized governance as local assemblies fill the vacuum.

events.description: Citizen juries issue a call to put the BCI and former Council policies on open public trial, setting a schedule for review.
Residents and juries present evidence of wrongful score denials, disappearances, and Halden's secret BCI directives, sparking public outrage.
Rada Miskovic and Sven Halek reveal personal logs showing Halden designed a BCI fail-safe: enough documented abuse would trigger system self-deactivation.
After days of debate, citizen juries vote to find the BCI 'guilty' of systemic harm. The BCI displays a written apology and all scoring halts.
With scoring tools disabled, local assemblies and grassroots organizations step in to manage essential services, as Stenograd adapts to direct democracy without the BCI.
